definition: an abstraction belonging to or characteristic of two entities or parts together
opposite_reasoning: UnaryRelation provides the strongest conceptual opposition to BinaryRelation based on relational arity - the fundamental logical distinction between 1-place and 2-place predicates. This is mathematically clean (arity: 1 vs 2), semantically meaningful (single-entity properties vs two-entity relationships), and exists in SUMO ontology. For Fisher-LDA, this creates a clear axis distinguishing relational complexity. While this may have limited direct AI safety utility, it provides coherent semantic structure for the ontology space.
